record.description: Robert Herrick a popular novelist and English Professor at the University of Chicago was the first owner of what is today the Calvert House. Subsequently, the Japanese government converted it into a consulate and Chi Psi fraternity to a lodge. From 1942, when the Chicago Archdiocese purchased it, the building's names have been, respectively the Calvert Club, the DeSales House in honor of St. Francis DeSales, and finally Calvert House.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
